DIRTYCODE_API int32_t NetConnQuery (const char *pDevice, NetConfigRecT *pList, int32_t iSize)
 Query the list of available connection configurations. This list is loaded from the specified device. The list is returned in a simple fixed width array with one string per array element. The caller can find the user portion of the config name via strchr(item, '#')+1. More...

DIRTYCODE_API uint32_t NetConnElapsed (void)
 Return elapsed time in milliseconds. The epoch (zero time) is not defined. This function should be used to determine elapsed time by calling once, saving the result, then later calling again and subtracting the original result from the new result. This will give the elapsed time in millisecs. More...
 
DIRTYCODE_API void NetConnSleep (int32_t iMilliSecs)

DIRTYCODE_API int32_t NetConnIdleDel (void(*proc)(void *data, uint32_t tick), void *data)
 Remove a previously added idle handler. The data parameter must match what was given when the function was added. More...
 
DIRTYCODE_API void NetConnIdle (void)
 Provide "life" to the network code. This function needs to be called periodically (typically once per game loop, generally speaking 5-10hz minimum) for the network code to function properly. More...

Function Documentation

DIRTYCODE_API void DirtyCertCAPreloadCerts ( const char *  pServiceName)

Initialize a CA preload request.

Parameters
*pServiceName- servicename to identify CA preload set ("gamename-gameyear-platform")
Note
Unlike the explicit CA load, a preload request is fire and forget, and will clean up after itself when complete.
Version
04/18/2012 (jbrookes)

References DirtyCertRefT::crit, DIRTYCERT_MAXREQUESTS, DirtyCertCARequestT::eStatus, DirtyCertCARequestT::eType, DirtyCertRefT::iCount, DirtyCertCARequestT::iRefCount, NetCritEnter(), NetCritLeave(), NetPrintf, DirtyCertRefT::requests, RS_NOT_STARTED, and RT_PREFETCH.

Referenced by DirtyCertCARequestCert().

DIRTYCODE_API int32_t DirtyCertControl ( int32_t  iControl,
int32_t  iValue,
int32_t  iValue2,
void *  pValue 
)

Set module behavior based on input selector.

Parameters
iControl- input selector
iValue- selector input
iValue2- selector input
*pValue- selector input
Returns
int32_t - selector result
Note
iControl can be one of the following:
        SELECTOR    DESCRIPTION
        'prld'      Enables/disables preload
        'snam'      Sets service name to use for on-demand requests
        'time'      Sets CA request timeout in milliseconds (default=30s)
Version
01/24/2012 (szhu)

References DirtyCertRefT::bPreload, DirtyCertRefT::crit, FALSE, NetCritEnter(), NetCritLeave(), NetPrintf, TRUE, and DirtyCertRefT::uTimeout.

Referenced by NetConnControl(), and NetConnDirtyCertCreate().

DIRTYCODE_API int32_t NetConnConnect ( const NetConfigRecT *  pConfig,
const char *  pOption,
int32_t  iData 
)

Used to bring the networking online with a specific configuration. Uses the configuration returned by NetConnQuery.

Parameters
*pConfig- the configuration entry from NetConnQuery
*pOption- asciiz list of config parameters "peerport=<port>" to specify peer port to be opened by upnp.
iData- platform-specific
Returns
int32_t - negative=error, zero=success
Version
01/18/02 (GWS)

References NetConnRefT::eState, NetConnRefT::iPeerPort, NETCONN_DEFAULT_UPNP_PORT, NetPrintf, NetConnRefT::pProtoUpnp, ProtoUpnpControl(), and ST_CONN.

DIRTYCODE_API int32_t NetConnDisconnect ( void  )

Used to bring down the network connection. After calling this, it would be necessary to call NetConnConnect to bring the connection back up or NetConnShutdown to completely shutdown all network support.

Returns
int32_t - negative=error, zero=success
Version
02/09/02 (GWS)

References NetConnRefT::eState, NetConnRefT::pProtoUpnp, ProtoUpnpControl(), and ST_CONN.

Referenced by NetConnShutdown().

DIRTYCODE_API uint32_t NetConnElapsed ( void  )

Return elapsed time in milliseconds. The epoch (zero time) is not defined. This function should be used to determine elapsed time by calling once, saving the result, then later calling again and subtracting the original result from the new result. This will give the elapsed time in millisecs.

Returns
uint32_t - elapsed milliseconds
Version
1.0 03/10/01 (GWS) First Version

References NetTick().

DIRTYCODE_API void NetConnIdle ( void  )

Provide "life" to the network code. This function needs to be called periodically (typically once per game loop, generally speaking 5-10hz minimum) for the network code to function properly.

Version
1.0 03/10/01 (GWS) First Version

References FALSE, NetConnStatus(), NetTick(), NetTickDiff, and TRUE.

DIRTYCODE_API int32_t NetConnIdleAdd ( void(*)(void *data, uint32_t tick)  proc,
void *  data 
)

Add an idle handler that will get called periodically. The frequency of calls is not guarenteed, but should be 60Hz min.

Parameters
*proc- callback function
*data- reference data provided to callback function
Returns
int32_t - negative=error, zero=success
Version
1.0 03/10/01 (GWS) First Version

References data, NETCONN_MAXIDLEHANDLERS, NetPrintf, and proc.

Referenced by ConnApiCreate2(), HttpManagerCreate(), LobbyLanCreate2(), NetResourceCreate(), ProtoUpnpCreate(), QosApiCreate(), and VoipCommonStartup().

void *  data 
)

Parameters
*proc- callback function
*data- same value given to NetConnIdleAdd

int32_t - negative=error, zero=success

DIRTYCODE_API int32_t NetConnQuery ( const char *  pDevice,
NetConfigRecT *  pList,
int32_t  iSize 
)

Query the list of available connection configurations. This list is loaded from the specified device. The list is returned in a simple fixed width array with one string per array element. The caller can find the user portion of the config name via strchr(item, '#')+1.

Parameters
*pDevice- device to scan (mc0:, mc1:, pfs0:, pfs1:)
*pList- buffer to store output array in
iSize- length of buffer in bytes
Returns
int32_t - negative=error, else number of configurations
Version
01/18/02 (GWS)

Parameters
uMachineId- new value
Version
01/31/2014 (cvienneau)

DIRTYCODE_API int32_t NetConnStartup ( const char *  pParams)

Bring the network connection module to life. Does not actually start any network activity.

Parameters
*pParams- startup parameters
Returns
int32_t - zero=success, negative=failure
Note
pParams can contain the following terms:
        -noupnp                           : disable UPNP
        -servicename=<game-year-platform> : set servicename required for SSL use
        -affinity=<mask as hex>           : cpu affinity we set for our internal threads
Version
3/10/01 (GWS)

References DirtyMemAlloc(), DirtyMemFree(), DirtyMemGroupQuery(), NetConnRefT::eState, NetConnRefT::iMemGroup, NetConnRefT::iPeerPort, NetConnRefT::iThreadCpuAffinity, NETCONN_DEFAULT_UPNP_PORT, NETCONN_ERROR_ALREADY_STARTED, NETCONN_ERROR_DIRTYCERT_CREATE, NETCONN_ERROR_NO_MEMORY, NETCONN_ERROR_PROTOSSL_CREATE, NETCONN_ERROR_PROTOUPNP_CREATE, NETCONN_ERROR_SOCKET_CREATE, NETCONN_MEMID, NetConnCopyParam(), NetConnDirtyCertCreate(), NetConnShutdown(), NetPrintf, NetConnRefT::pMemGroupUserData, NetConnRefT::pProtoUpnp, pRef, ProtoSSLStartup(), ProtoUpnpCreate(), and SocketCreate().

DIRTYCODE_API int32_t NetConnStatus ( int32_t  iKind,
int32_t  iData,
void *  pBuf,
int32_t  iBufSize 
)

Check general network connection status. Different selectors return different status attributes.

Parameters
iKind- status selector
iData- (optional) selector specific
*pBuf- (optional) pointer to output buffer
iBufSize- (optional) size of output buffer
Returns
int32_t - selector specific
Note
iKind can be one of the following:
        addr: ip address of client
        affn: get the thread cpu affinity setting
        bbnd: broadband true or false
        conn: true/false indication of whether connection in progress
        ethr: mac address of adapter based on iData (0=first, otherwise=first active) (returned in pBuf), 0=success, negative=error
        locl: return locality (Windows locale) for local system, ex. 'enUS'
              For unrecognized locale, 'zzZZ' will be returned.
        locn: return location (Windows location) for local system, ex. 'zzCA'
              The language part of the return value should be ignored by the caller.
              If local system has 'no location' set, 'zzZZ' will be returned.
        macx: mac address of adapter based on iData (0=first, otherwise=first active) (returned in pBuf), 0=success, negative=error
        onln: true/false indication of whether network is operational
        open: true/false indication of whether network code running
        type: NETCONN_IFTYPE_*
        upnp: return protoupnp port info, if available
        vers: return DirtySDK version
Version
03/10/2001 (gschaefer)

References DIRTYSDK_VERSION, ds_stricmp(), NetConnRefT::eState, FALSE, NetConnRefT::iThreadCpuAffinity, LOBBYAPI_COUNTRY_UNKNOWN, LOBBYAPI_LANGUAGE_UNKNOWN, LOBBYAPI_LOCALITY_UNKNOWN, LOBBYAPI_LocalizerTokenCreate, LOBBYAPI_LocalizerTokenGetShortFromString, NETCONN_IFTYPE_ETHER, NETCONNWIN_COUNTRY_UNKNOWN_STR, NetPrintf, NetConnRefT::pProtoUpnp, PROTOUPNP_STATUS_ADDPORTMAP, ProtoUpnpStatus(), SocketGetLocalAddr(), SocketInfo(), ST_CONN, and TRUE.

Referenced by DirtyAddrGetLocalAddr(), NetConnGetEnvStr(), NetConnIdle(), NetConnMAC(), ProtoUpnpControl(), QosApiGetNatType(), SocketLookup(), and VoipStartup().

DIRTYCODE_API void NetConnTiming ( uint8_t  uEnableTiming)

Enable or disable the timing of netconnidles.

Parameters
uEnableTiming- on or off
Returns
None.
Version
1.0 11/06/09 (jrainy) First Version
